title: What are the differences between modernism, postmodernism, neo-modernism and metamodernism? What are some examples of each? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh, to be young again. Seduced by the labeling. Ever since Vasari and his ‘renaissance’, art ‘historians’ and ‘critics’ have been seduced into believing that ‘art’ can be divided into ‘convenient boxes’. And if you belong in a box that somehow gives value to the work; balderdash and poppycock! The wider the box . . . Some might ‘label’ Monet, Seurat, Sisley, Renoir even Degas as ‘impressionists’ but their styles are unique; as different as chalk and cheese. That alone belies their affinity to a ‘movement’. Maybe a sense of possibility but nowhere a box to be labeled. Was van Eyck ‘Gothic’, was Dürer ‘renaissance’, was Turner an ‘impressionist’, was Magritte a ‘surrealist’. You see, the boxes don’t quite line up. Boxes seldom do. Art is art and boxes seldom provide clarity.
